findings.title: The burn mechanism implemented via joinEvent() and joinEventFor does not burn the mgp tokens
findings.description: The current implementation of the `joinEvent()` and `joinEventFor()` function transfers tokens to a blackhole address, simulating token burning. However, this approach might create a false sense of burning, as it does not reflect in the `totalSupply()` of the token.

findings.title: Lack of Storage Gap in Upgradeable Contracts
findings.description: The contracts do not have a storage gap at the end, which can cause issues during upgrades.

findings.title: Transfer whitelist not enforced
findings.description: The transfer whitelist is not enforced, and mint/burn/transfer will not be enabled.

findings.title: Hook _beforeTokenTransfer would revert token transfers regardless of transferWhitelist
findings.description: The implemented `_beforeTokenTransfer` hook always reverts token transfers regardless of `transferWhitelist` status.

findings.title: Deprecated safeApprove() function in burnVlmgp() function
findings.description: The `safeApprove()` function is deprecated and can cause a denial-of-service if the existing allowance is non-zero. It's recommended to use `safeIncreaseAllowance()` and `safeDecreaseAllowance()` instead.

findings.title: Missing zero address checks
findings.description: No validation for 0 address in function joinEventFor contract MGPBurnEventManager which may lead to unexpected storage updates.

findings.title: OwnableUpgradeable : Does not implement 2-Step-Process for transferring ownership
findings.description: The contracts VLMGP.sol and MGPBurnEventManager.sol do not implement a 2-Step-Process for transferring ownership, which can lead to easily losing contract ownership when making mistakes during transfer.

findings.title: Outdated OpenZeppelin Dependencies Leading to Function Selector Clash in TransparentUpgradeableProxy
findings.description: The current version of openzeppelin-contracts in use is 4.7.3, while the latest version available is 5.0.0. This can lead to a Denial of Service due to function selector clash in TransparentUpgradeableProxy.

findings.title: MGP token holders can access joinEvent() and joinEventFor() even when VLMGP.sol is paused
findings.description: When only the VLMGP.sol contract is paused, users are unable to call the burnVlmgp() function, preventing them from burning their VLMGP tokens for MGP tokens to participate in events. This creates an imbalance that enables a subset of users to exploit the system, potentially gaining unfair advantages and initiating a Denial of Service (DoS) attack on users who have staked in the VLMGP contract.

findings.title: Missing zero amount check
findings.description: The joinEvent and joinEventFor functions do not validate if the _mgpBurnAmount is zero before performing operations.

findings.title: There is a risk of centralization of address blackHole
findings.description: The `blackHole` address may be set to an account address controlled by the project party, which will allow this address to obtain all the tokens that should be burned.
